column4: Sorry to re-ask, but I need a hand getting my sound back.  I think I lost it during an update? and didn't notice right away, so I don't know what happened.  I've tried rebuilding ALSA and following the debugging sound problems page with no luck.  I've got an onboard Ensoniq sound device that aplay sees, and all my audio controls are intact.  Don't know what else to try.
you ran the amixer ?
yup
the modules obviously loading correctly since its detected correctly yes ?
it looks like they are as far as I can tell
hang on, I'll take a look
what is the lspci on the esonique sound card ?
well I see my sound card plastered all over my lsmod output. where do I find the lspci?
just type sudo lspci

I'm a tard, I just figured that out.  I've got a different number showing for that than I have listed in lsmod.  I think this may have been something I did when rebuilding ALSA?  It was the closest to my device.  Still an Ensoniq module, but a different number
sounds like it - need to make sure the modules for alsa are the correct ones
http://www.alsa-project.org/main/index.php/Matrix:Vendor-Ensoniq
according to that page, it still uses the same driver
I'm trying to reinstall my sound module following the alsa project instructions andi5 posted for me, but I get a error when I try to install the alsa-driver package
I may have run into this problem when I initially installed it and didn't notice it?
if you dust alsa all together you wont have gnome boot
if you are receiving errors plz use the pastebin so we can know whats going on
Pastebin?
Thanks :)
did you install the linux-kernel-headers ?
sudo apt-get install linux-headers-generic linux-source
